messages.subject: Re:Who benefits??
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 6/13/04 8:48:33 AM Pacific Daylight Time, ... I ve run up against this way of thinking some too - I decided I do/did homeschool for my
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 6/13/04 8:48:33 AM Pacific Daylight Time,
AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com writes:


> She
> said "You're homeschooling for YOUR benefit, not for Kirby's. You're being
> selfish." (might not be exact words, but 95% right, if I've forgotten a
> little;
> "selfish" and the idea that it was for me and not Kirby were in there).
>
>
I"ve run up against this way of thinking some too - I decided I do/did
homeschool for my benefit. I try to do my best with everything that comes my way in
life. Mothering is/was a BIG part of my life and to do the very best in that
role, I un/homeschooled. People that have a problem with that are dealing
with their own issues - and our choices threaten them. That is sad.

On the sport deal - I second the posting to look up the rules, and make sure
the the school you are working with can help you.

Connie
www.homeschoolingreflections.com



[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
